column1: Salina Cruz is a major seaport on the Pacific coast of the Mexican state of Oaxaca. It is the state's third-largest city and is the municipal seat of the municipality of the same name.
It is part of the Tehuantepec District in the west of the Istmo Region.

column1: The port was developed in the late 19th century due to its location at the southern terminus of the Ferrocarril Transístmico

column1: == History ==
Salina Cruz
column2: was founded by the Spanish in 1522 under whose command Pedro de Alvarado came. It was given the name "Salina de la Santa Cruz" as its official foundation day was the Catholic day of the holy cross.

column1: Salina Cruz is situated near the mouth of the Río Tehuantepec
column2: on the open coast of the Isthmus of Tehuantepec on the Gulf of Tehuantepec
column3: and has no natural harbour. There was only a small Native village before Salina Cruz was chosen as the Pacific terminus of the  Tehuantepec National Railway
column4: whereupon a modern town was laid out and built on adjacent higher ground and an artificial harbour was built by the Mexican government to accommodate the expected traffic.

column1: The new port was opened to traffic in 1907 and in 1909 its population was largely composed of labourers. The harbour was formed by the construction of two breakwaters
column5: which curve toward each other at their outer extremities and leave an entrance 635 ft (194 m) wide. The enclosed space is divided into an outer and inner harbour by a double line of quays wide enough to carry six great warehouses with electric cranes on both sides and a number of railway tracks. Connected with the new port works was one of the then-largest dry docks in the world 610 ft (190 m) long and 89 ft (27 m) wide
column6: with a depth of 28 ft (8.5 m) on its sill at low water. The works were planned to handle an immense volume of transcontinental freight
column7: and before they were finished four steamship lines had arranged regular calls at Salina Cruz.

== Climate ==
Salina Cruz experiences a tropical savanna climate (Köppen: Aw). This is because from November to March the precipitation is much smaller
column2: mainly concentrated in summer similar to Asian monsoons
column3: although it is not categorized as such. The seasons of the year can not be well demarcated
column4: generally better defined by the rainy season in the central months of the year. Although precipitation is 1122.3 mm on average
column5: it is usually concentrated in the summer
column6: with August averaging 330.7 mm and February at only 1.6 mm. It is not uncommon for temperatures to rise from 35 °C at some times of the year even in its coastal location. The winter is unknown and at times there is just something like the end of fall to early spring
column8: moreover no temperature below 10 °C has been recorded as in the Gulf of Mexico. High temperatures are present for much of the year.  The hours of sunshine are always well above 200 hours a month
